intro: Epiphora, commonly known as the "ice plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. These succulent plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. They are characterized by their fleshy, water-storing leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that often bloom in shades of pink, purple, or white. Epiphora species are adapted to hot, dry environments and can survive with minimal water. Their unique appearance and ability to thrive in harsh conditions make them popular among succulent enthusiasts.
